definition: king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
to store/to save/to have in reserve/heir/Taiwan pr. [chu2]

sentences.english: He appropriately opted for Wellington boots and fisherman pants while fishing on the River Dee with the Duchess of Cornwall.
sentences.chinese: 在梯河釣魚時，王儲夫婦選擇了漁夫漁婦的裝扮。

sentences.english: The Crown Prince has visited our soldiers posted in Iraq and in Mali.
sentences.chinese: 王儲訪問了我們在伊拉克和馬裏的駐兵。

sentences.english: The finishes can withstand pasteurised and some sterilised filling processes, Crown says.
sentences.chinese: 能承受的成績和一些經消毒灌裝過程，王儲說。

sentences.english: Hyde James in 1660 with the Crown Prince married.
sentences.chinese: 海德在1660年與王儲詹姆士結婚。

sentences.english: After the Zhou capital was sacked by western barbarian tribes, crown prince Ji Yijiu fled to the east.
sentences.chinese: 之後，周資本被解僱了西方蠻族，王儲繼久逃到東。

sentences.english: The prince wore a white hat to match his suit.
sentences.chinese: 爲了與白色外套相搭配，王儲戴了頂白帽子。

sentences.english: Prince Vajiralongkorn can expect no such leeway.
sentences.chinese: 哇集拉隆功王儲則別想有這種權威。

sentences.english: For 33 years, his younger brother Prince Hassan bin Tallal had been the crown prince.
sentences.chinese: 三十三年來他一直立他的弟弟哈桑爲王儲。

sentences.english: Despite this, only yesterday, the Crown Prince was definitely coming to the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 儘管如此，就在昨天，王儲還確定一定會來參加婚禮。

sentences.english: In Bahrain, the crown prince went on television Friday and appealed for calm.
sentences.chinese: 在巴林，王儲週五在電視上呼籲示威者保持冷靜。

pinyin: Sha1 wu1 di4 A1 la1 bo2

definition: variant of 邱吉爾|邱吉尔[Qiu1 ji2 er3]
Ur (Sumerian city c. 4500 BC in modern Iraq)
to swear the oath of office
to succeed sb in a job/successor
